body_content.explanation: relating to discrimination (= unfair or worse treatment of someone because of the group they belong to) against disabled people (= people with a condition that makes it difficult for them to do something that most other people can do), or resulting from prejudice (= unfair or unreasonable beliefs about a group of people) against them, based on the belief that they are not as good as other people:
examples: We believe he was targeted because he was disabled, which makes this a disablist crime.
"Institutional disablism" describes the disablist attitudes, practice, and culture of an entire organization.
